programme.desc: David descends beneath the waves at night in the state of the art Triton submersible, the first of its kind to visit the reef. He meets some of the tiny coral animals that built the reef and helped to turn it into an underwater wonderland.

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David continues his exploration of the Great Barrier Reef, aboard the research vessel the Alucia. He discovers the incredible animals that visit the reef every year, from birds to whales, some travelling thousands of kilometres to get there.

programme.title: Great Barrier Reef with David Attenborough
programme.desc: David examines what the next few decades hold for this remarkable community of animals, as well as what is being done to save it.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Dragons And Damsels
programme.desc: They are beautiful, their behaviours are as complex as mammals and they have existed since the dinosaurs. Join David Attenborough as he delves into the life of dragonflies and damselflies.

programme.title: Pride Rules
programme.desc: Contend with the challenges of the rainy season, which turns everything green and spoils the lions camouflage.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: Sir David Attenborough charts the story of animals who defy gravity, starting with the planets first flyers: the insect.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: After meeting some critters who glide through life in Borneo, Sir David Attenborough decides to turn back the clock.

programme.title: David Attenboroughs Conquest of the Skies
programme.desc: In the final episode in the series, Sir David Attenborough turns his attention to the creatures that dominate our skies today.

programme.title: Coastal Africa
programme.desc: This is the story of the Golden Forest, the vast expanses of kelp that lines Africas southwestern shore. Fed by an upwelling of nutrients from deep in the Atlantic, the kelp forest nurtures four distinct worlds.

programme.title: Coastal Africa
programme.sub-title: Algoa Bay: Last Refuge of the African Penguin
programme.desc: Wildlife along the coast of Africa.

programme.title: Pride Rules
programme.desc: Contend with the challenges of the rainy season, which turns everything green and spoils the lions camouflage.

programme.title: Guardians of the Wild
programme.desc: Madonna is the first Kinda baboon ever to be studied from birth to adulthood and now, critically, she is looking for a mate. Only recently identified as a species in their own right, Kinda baboons are little known and little understood.

programme.title: Guardians of the Wild
programme.desc: Across Africa 97 black rhinos have been killed for their horns. In 1997 the species was declared officially extinct in Zambia, but now, thanks to an ambitious reintroduction plan, they are back.

programme.title: Animal Senses
programme.desc: The first sense to evolve in the first animals was chemoreception. It means being able to detect chemicals in the animals environment. This helps animals find prey and mates, and to sense predators from a distance.

programme.title: Animal Senses
programme.desc: The sense of touch is useful to feel physical forces such as bites, changes in temperature and texture. Some animals have become extra sensitive to feel very faint vibrations, which give them a lot of information about their environment.

programme.title: Animal Senses
programme.desc: Seeing the world is one of the most amazing animal adaptations. Different types of eyes give animals different types of vision, and in some cases they can be extraordinary.

programme.title: Animal Senses
programme.desc: Sound waves are produced by movement. Animals have evolved organs to detect those sound waves in the air or water to perceive movements in their environment. This can be used to find prey, predators, and mates. These are some of the animals that have mastered the sense of hearing.

programme.title: Animal Senses
programme.desc: Some animals have senses that humans cant even conceive. With those powers they can do marvellous things.

programme.title: Animal Senses
programme.desc: Humans have sharp senses, which we use explore our environment. Vibrations in the air, light, and chemicals in our food and in the air give us the information we need to survive. But some animals have taken those senses and, through evolution, turned them into marvels of biological engineering.

programme.title: Arctic Secrets
programme.desc: The Hudson Bay lowlands are part of North Americas largest wetland. Over 300,000 square kilometers of muskeg, a vast bogland as far as the eye can see characterised by water soaked peat, mosses and stunted trees.

programme.title: Monkey Life
programme.desc: A look at the lives of monkeys, chimps, orangutans, and apes living at the worlds biggest sanctuary, the 65-acre Monkey World Ape Rescue Centre in Wareham, Dorset.

programme.desc: Beni faces a day of reckoning as all the forest school students are held back for a weigh-in; Alba is back in isolation after being diagnosed with typhoid.

programme.title: Wildlife ER
programme.desc: Follows a range of dedicated professionals and volunteers as they look after unwell animals and carefully nurse them back to health at the RSPCA Wildlife Hospital in Brisbane, Australia.

programme.title: Wild Battleground
programme.desc: Discover how different animals use the terrain to their advantage and their unique attributes to defeat their opponents at each location, becoming masters of communication, camouflage, diplomacy and combat.

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood looks at clever new methods that the police and the public are using to catch crooks.

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A family business is attacked by a former employee wanting cash, and he has backup. Also, when an armed man bursts into a shop, terrified staff hide in fear for their lives, but a customer walks in unaware of what is happening.

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: A series of crimes drives businesses off the rails in Devon, targeting railways both large-scale and small. Also a snooker club barman turns detective when two strangers come in and steal money meant for a charity that means the world to him.

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: After a customer is thrown out of a pub for fighting, he takes revenge in a horrific way: by driving at high speed into a group of locals. Also, some diners in a restaurant try to leave without paying, but the owner cottons on to their plan.

programme.title: Border Patrol
programme.desc: New Zealands Customs officers attempt to enforce the law and keep New Zealands borders safe from harm.

programme.title: Stop, Search, Seize
programme.desc: Join Irelands border force as they fight to stop gangs of organised smugglers from bringing drugs, money, guns, cars and even exotic animals into the country.

programme.title: UK Border Force
programme.desc: A man is caught carrying false identity documents, while another passenger is suspected of entering the country to work on a student visa.

programme.desc: A series about the New Zealand Customs agents.

programme.desc: Officers want to know why a French traveller is exhibiting nervous behaviour. Biosecurity officers discover a disgusting concealment in the luggage of a woman arriving from Vietnam.

programme.title: Caught on Dashcam
programme.desc: Counts down some of the most incredible, spectacular and hilarious real life crashes in the world. Video cameras capture massive pile ups, road rage and misguided overtaking manoeuvres.

programme.desc: A young man, who had been in therapy with an attractive and sexy therapist, is found murdered.

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses...

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a rail journey through Germany, steered by a Bradshaws Continental Railway Guide published in 1936. His unique window on Europe between the world wars takes him through a tumultuous period in German history, when the nations first democracy and its vibrant culture of art, design and decadence were swept away by fascism, nationalism and the increasing likelihood of war.

programme.title: Great Indian Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On an epic railway journey from Lucknow in Uttar Pradesh to Kolkata in West Bengal, Michael Portillo uses his Bradshaws 1913 Handbook of Indian, Foreign and Colonial Travel, published when the British Raj was fifty-five years old, to chart a course through Indias history from the days of The East India Company to the dawn of independence.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: Lifelong friends and skippers, Jimmy Buchan and Sandy Watt, take stock of the human cost of one of the most dangerous occupations known to mankind. As Jimmys trawler Amity lands a hefty catch of prawns, he comes to terms with his fears for the safety of his own life and those of his crew. Meanwhile, Sandys young apprentice John Duncan Campbell gets the chance hes been waiting for.

programme.title: Trawlermen
programme.desc: A special insight into the struggles of fishermen who carry out the most dangerous job in Britain.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek rubs shoulders with pop music royalty when he picks up a classic Morgan sports car. A World War Two ambulance arrives at Thornton le Dale and a Ford Model T needs a new home.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: This week at the Mathewsons, there is a 1982 Audi Quattro and a Sunbeam Alpine. Plus, Derek takes delivery of a beautiful green Renault van, previously used as a bread van in Paris.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The Restos team try their hardest not to go too far on an Opel Manta. And a Peugeot 205 GTI brings back happy B-road memories for a mechanic who owned one.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will benefit from an owners decision that his broken vehicle is beyond repair, and secure a Mercedes 190 investment that they hope to restore.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: In the knife-edge world of hunters and hunted, mammals ability to learn new tricks is their key to survival. A killer whale is shown sneaking into a pool where elephant seal pups learn to swim, slow motion cameras reveal how the star-nosed mole can smell prey underwater, and young ibex demonstrate how to escape a fox by running up an almost vertical cliff face.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: An investigation of marine invertebrates and the way they thrive in the toughest parts of the ocean. Divers swim into a shoal of predatory Humboldt squid as the creatures emerge from the depths to hunt in packs, time-lapse photography reveals thousands of starfish gathering under the Arctic ice to devour a seal carcass, and a giant octopus protects her eggs by using her body to wall up a cave, starving to death in the process.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: An incredible look at plants and their ingenious solutions to lifes challenges. Time-lapse photography reveals plants acting like fly-paper, or spring-loaded traps, to catch insects, while vines are shown developing suckers and claws to haul themselves up trees. Later the importance of shape for survival is illustrated by the dragons blood tree, which captures mist and shades its roots through its unusual form.

programme.title: Life
programme.desc: An amazing look at primates and their survival skills, from complex societies to tool use. Huge armies of Hamadryas baboons are seen battling on the plains of Ethiopia in order to steal females and settle old scores, Japanese macaques beat the cold by lounging in thermal springs - but only if they come from the right family, and an orang-utan baby fails in its struggle to make an umbrella out of leaves to keep off the rain.

programme.title: Turkey with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: In the Taurus Mountains Simon stays with descendants of the original Turks, nomads known as Yoruks, whose lifestyle is under threat from the amodern world and an increasingly Islamic government.

programme.title: Flipping Bangers
programme.desc: Gus and Will benefit from an owners decision that his broken vehicle is beyond repair, and secure a Mercedes 190 investment that they hope to restore.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team fly the flag for King and country with one of their most luxurious purchases to date - a 1981 Rolls Royce Silver Spirit.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team think they can smell profit by choosing one of the simplest cars ever built, the VW Beetle.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: Bangers and Cash spin-off series that follows the journey of a vehicle purchased at a Mathewsons classic car auction, before being repaired, restored and re-auctioned.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash: Restoring Classics
programme.desc: The team pay over the odds for a VW Campervan, but can they hope to break even when they turn out a lovely bus for auction.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Shopping from home.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.desc: With Nazi Germanys rise to power, a long-abandoned canal project in East Prussia is resurrected, but the true purpose of this massive waterway comes into question.

programme.title: The Great War in Numbers
programme.desc: Hear how the arrival of American forces and an Allied counteroffensive in 1918 helped defeat Germany. Tragically, 11,000 men were killed or injured on Armistice Day.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Objects featured include a communion book originally owned by the poet Wilfred Owen, an Aston Martin sports car first driven by a RAF Group Captain in World War Two, and a remarkably well preserved finely embroidered `stump work box from the 17th-century.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: The team travel to the Lake District, where theres an eclectic mix of objects. This includes a writing desk from the Czars Palace bought after the Russian Revolution, over 100 vintage fire helmets, and Edwardian weight lifting equipment.

programme.desc: In the first episode, Robson Green sets out on one of the most iconic walks in the UK, the Hadrians Wall path.

programme.title: Greece with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: Simon Reeve travels from the islands of the Aegean to Greeces capital, Athens. To learn more about Greece and the Greeks, he meets an extraordinary cast of characters, from gun-toting priests to the last remaining sponge divers. Getting behind the postcard image of this beautiful country, he finds out how the Greeks are coming to terms with a seemingly endless crisis.

The seat of power beckons in Kutaisi, home to the wonderful glass dome built for the Parliament of Georgia when it moved here from the capital, Tbilisi, in 2012.

programme.title: Rab Ne Bana Di Jodi
programme.desc: After the wedding ceremony between Surinder Sahni and Taani, Surinder discovers that his new wife cares little for him. Taani soon falls in love with her new dance partner, Raj, unaware that he is in fact her husband.
